diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Urinary tract infection, Acute on chronic kidney disease, Gastritis, Anemia, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus, Hypertension, Coronary artery disease
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with dysuria, lower abdominal pain, and new onset diarrhea and vomiting consistent with symptoms of diverticulitis, along with recurrent UTIs and a history of chronic kidney disease. Diagnostic imaging and laboratory findings, including a stool test and urine cultures, supported these conclusions.
